intro: Dodecatheon ellipticum, commonly known as the narrowleaf glory-of-the-snow, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats. Dodecatheon ellipticum is known for its early spring blooming period, often appearing before the canopy of trees has fully opened.
